title: Hoops
subtitle: A different kind of Social Media — connect through anonymous letter-based chatting.
myResponsibilities: Implemented user onboarding with real-time username validation
Built interest-based and personality-based matching system
Designed and developed letter-based anonymous chat system
Created a clean UI using MUI and React hooks
Handled schedule integration and profile customization features
methodology: Built with an iterative **Agile** process, incorporating feedback-driven design sprints and component-based modular development for rapid UI updates and scalability.
about: Hoops is an anonymous social media platform focused on meaningful connections through letter-writing. Unlike traditional apps, users interact without profile pictures, eliminating biases and encouraging depth.

Users can discover friends based on shared interests and Myers-Briggs personality compatibility. Each letter must be at least 600 characters, nudging users toward thoughtful communication. Avatars are randomized and customizable.
It supports adding class schedules and selecting interests to better match users and encourage real-world coordination — all while maintaining anonymity.

gallery.alt: Login and signup with live validation
Friend suggestions based on interests and personality

challengesAndLessons.challenge: Ensuring performant real-time username validation with each keystroke
challengesAndLessons.solution: Implemented a debounce strategy to limit API calls, initially hitting a staging DB before final validation from production DB on submit. Learned how to balance UX fluidity with backend load.

challengesAndLessons.challenge: Matching users on interests and personality without invasive profiling
challengesAndLessons.solution: Used simple Myers-Briggs personality inputs and structured interest tagging, maintaining user privacy. Gained experience in designing inclusive and bias-aware matching algorithms.
